title: Fortnite Basics
description: Test your fundamental knowledge of Fortnite Battle Royale!

questions.question: How many players are in a standard Fortnite Battle Royale match?
questions.explanation: A standard Fortnite Battle Royale match has 100 players competing to be the last one standing!

questions.question: Fortnite was released in 2017.
questions.explanation: Fortnite Battle Royale was released on September 26, 2017, and quickly became a global phenomenon!

questions.question: What is the name of the storm that shrinks the playable area?
questions.explanation: The Storm is Fortnite's signature shrinking play zone that forces players closer together!

questions.question: What company developed Fortnite?
questions.explanation: Epic Games developed Fortnite using their Unreal Engine!

questions.question: You can build structures in Fortnite Battle Royale.
questions.explanation: Building is one of Fortnite's most unique features! Players can harvest materials and build walls, ramps, floors, and roofs.

questions.question: What are the three building materials in Fortnite?
questions.explanation: Wood, Stone, and Metal are the three materials. Wood builds fastest but is weakest, while Metal is strongest but builds slowest!

questions.question: What is the in-game currency used to buy cosmetics in Fortnite?
questions.explanation: V-Bucks (Vindertech Bucks) are Fortnite's premium currency used to purchase skins, emotes, and the Battle Pass!

questions.question: The Battle Bus is powered by a balloon.
questions.explanation: The iconic Battle Bus is a blue school bus carried by a hot air balloon that drops players onto the island!
